etymology.description: Two interwoven threads 幺 with a distinguishing mark 亠 on top; depicts a rope, cf. 率 and 弦; distinct from 己 and 乃.
etymology.interpretation: Interwoven strands suggest a cord, with the top mark signaling something set apart or hidden. From the idea of a special braided thread came meanings of subtle depth and mystery.

examples.chinese: 这道理很玄妙(這道理很玄妙)。
他的理论过于玄奥(他的理論過於玄奧)。
别把科学说成玄学(別把科學說成玄學)。
examples.pinyin: Bié bǎ kēxué shuō chéng xuánxué.
